page.title: 04Evacuation Part 2
page.content: {Mrs. G. Coe}lived in Slapton parish with her father. Her{father}was a {farmer.}When they knew that every body had to move out of their houses the first thing they had to do was to{find {some where}to stay.He went to Rowden farm near Widdicombe and also Bittaford.And he{bought one house and} {rented the other.}Once they found some where to go,they had to{thresh}the corn,{bail}the hay and all the turnips had to be pulled up.And just before they moved out they had to get all of their furniture out. When they were moving out they had{sailors}and{one} {land army girl}to help.At that time they all had{identity}cards.And where ever they went they had to take them with because if they were stopped by the{soldiers}or{home guards.}There were soldiers with mules at Pitt Farm and East Allington. ..
